  • Help

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AboutMenu
GUI window, in which further information about the game is shown.
AudioPlayer
A simple player that plays audio files
Character
represents a moving character(HungryBall/Enemy) in the games level
Cherry
An eatable fruit, which gives scorepoints and can be placed in the games level
Config
class that is meant for additional settings of the GUI classes
CustomLevel
represents a custom level.
Eatable
Interface for objects that grant the player score when eaten (like fruits ,enemies and scorepoints)
Enemy
represents enemies, which are controlled by the computer, in the games level
Fruit
represents static objects, that grant the player score when eaten (more than a normal scorepoint)
Game
class, where the game itself is created and started.
GameOverScreen
GUI window, in which the player's final score is shown, as well as a list of high scores and the option to enter a name if the player has achieved a high enough score.
GameSettingsMenu
GUI window, in which the user can choose options and set up a Game of Hungryball.
GifSequenceWriter
utility class for creating temporary .gif files.
HungryBall
represents the player characters (controlled by the players), in the games level
IngameGui
represent the Gui Class for the Game itself
IngameObject
represents characters and static objects that are used games levels
Level
represents the level/map on which the actual game is played.
LevelPreviewPanel
a Panel which is meant to be a non-playable preview of the level.
MainMenu
first GUI window, in which the user has several options to choose from.
MyKeyListener
The class MyKeyListener extends the KeyAdapter class and provides the implementation of keyPressed() and keyReleased() methods.
Painter
provides functions to paint IngameObjects.
PaintPanel
represents a panel, on which a level can be painted.
PowerUp
Objects that grants the player invulnerability and the ability to eat enemies, when eaten
ScoreBoard
Handles reads and writes from/to the scoreBoard.xml file
ScoreboardMenu
GUI window, in which the scoreboard is shown.
ScorePoint
static object in the level, that grants the player a small amount of score when eaten
SimpleLevel
represents a simple level with walls on the top and bottom.
Updater
class which provides several functions to update the state of the game.
Wall
static object in the level that the player can't move through
